ground_truth: She stares at her reflection critically and says this as if it were a threat, then notices a smudge on the mirror and wipes it off. The front door opens to reveal Carolyn, greeting us with the smile she thinks could sell ice to an Eskimo. Smiling, Carolyn leads a man and woman into the living room. They're thirtyish, and they've seen a lot of houses today. The man and woman glance around the dark room, unimpressed, and the woman wrinkles her face, skeptical. Carolyn enters, followed by a different couple in their fifties, and stands with another couple: African American, late twenties. The woman is pregnant. Carolyn stands by the pool next to two fortyish women. She locks the sliding glass door and starts to pull the vertical blinds shut, then stops. Standing very still, with the blinds casting shadows across her face, she starts to cry: brief, staccato sobs that seemingly escape against her will. Suddenly she slaps herself, hard, but the tears continue. She slaps herself again and repeatedly until she stops crying. She stands there, taking deep breaths until she has everything under control, then pulls the blinds shut, once again all business. She walks out calmly, leaving us alone in the dark, empty room. We're at a high-school basketball game where teenage boys play a fast and furious game. One team wearing pale blue and white uniforms scores a basket. Perky cheerleaders jump up and down as the crowd goes wild. Seated in the bleachers, next to the high school band, is a group of about twenty teenage girls, dressed in pale blue and white uniforms. Among them, Jane sits next to Angela Hayes. At sixteen, Angela is strikingly beautiful, with perfect even features, blonde hair, and a nubile young body; she's the archetypal American dream girl. Carolyn drives with Lester slumped in the passenger seat, and Carolyn stares at him, unsure of how to respond. The uniformed girls now stand in formation on the gym floor, and in the crowded stands, Lester and Carolyn find seats. They're well-rehearsed, but too young to carry off the ambitious Vegas routine they're attempting. Lester, watching from the stands, picks out his daughter. Jane performs well, concentrating, while dancing awkwardly next to her is Angela. Suddenly Angela looks right at us and smiles, a lazy, insolent smile. We're focused on Angela now, and everything starts to shift as the music acquires an eerie echo. We zoom slowly toward Lester as he watches, transfixed. The light on Angela grows stronger, and the other girls disappear entirely. Lester is suddenly alone in the stands, spellbound, as Angela looks directly at us now, dancing only for Lester. Her movements take on a blatantly erotic edge as she starts to unzip her uniform, teasing us with an expression that's both innocent and knowing, then.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: She gazes intently at her own reflection, scrutinizing it with a critical eye, and utters a statement as if it were a dire warning. Her attention is then drawn to a smudge marring the mirror's surface, which she promptly wipes away. The front door swings open, revealing Carolyn, who greets us with a smile so confident and persuasive that it seems capable of selling ice to an Eskimo. With a welcoming demeanor, Carolyn escorts a man and a woman into the living room. This couple, appearing to be in their thirties, has already toured numerous houses today. As they cast their eyes around the dimly lit room, their expressions reveal a lack of enthusiasm, and the woman, in particular, wrinkles her face in skepticism. Carolyn reenters the scene, this time accompanied by a different couple who appear to be in their fifties, and she stands alongside yet another couple: an African American pair in their late twenties, with the woman visibly pregnant. By the poolside, Carolyn stands next to two women who seem to be in their forties. She secures the sliding glass door and begins to draw the vertical blinds closed, but then hesitates. Standing motionless, with the blinds casting intricate shadows across her face, she unexpectedly begins to cry, her sobs brief and staccato, as if they are escaping her control. In a sudden, impulsive act, she slaps herself hard, but the tears persist. She continues to slap herself repeatedly until the crying ceases. She remains there, taking deep, calming breaths until she regains her composure, then resumes her task, pulling the blinds shut with a renewed sense of professionalism. She exits the room with a calm demeanor, leaving us alone in the dark, empty space. We find ourselves at a high-school basketball game, where teenage boys are engaged in a fast-paced, intense match. One team, clad in pale blue and white uniforms, scores a basket, prompting the perky cheerleaders to leap energetically as the crowd erupts in excitement. Seated in the bleachers, adjacent to the high school band, is a group of approximately twenty teenage girls, all dressed in matching pale blue and white uniforms. Among them, Jane sits beside Angela Hayes. At the age of sixteen, Angela is strikingly beautiful, with perfectly symmetrical features, blonde hair, and a youthful, alluring physique; she embodies the quintessential American dream girl. Carolyn drives with Lester slumped in the passenger seat, and she glances at him, uncertain of how to react. The uniformed girls now stand in formation on the gym floor, and in the bustling stands, Lester and Carolyn find their seats. The girls are well-rehearsed, yet their youth makes it challenging for them to convincingly execute the ambitious Vegas-style routine they are attempting. From his vantage point in the stands, Lester identifies his daughter. Jane performs with focus, while beside her, Angela dances with an awkwardness that contrasts with her beauty. Suddenly, Angela directs her gaze toward us and smiles, a lazy, insolent smile that captures our attention. Our focus shifts entirely to Angela, and as the music takes on an eerie echo, we slowly zoom in on Lester, who watches, utterly captivated. The light on Angela intensifies, and the other girls fade from view entirely. Lester finds himself alone in the stands, entranced, as Angela looks directly at us, dancing solely for Lester. Her movements become overtly seductive as she begins to unzip her uniform, teasing us with an expression that is both innocent and knowing, then.

In a moment that is unexpectedly poignant, she begins to cry, her sobs brief and staccato, as if they are escaping her control. In a sudden, impulsive act, she slaps herself hard, but the persistent tears refuse to cease. She continues to slap herself repeatedly until the crying finally stops. She remains there for a moment, taking deep, calming breaths as she works to regain her composure, and then she resumes her task, pulling the blinds shut with a renewed sense of professionalism. She exits the room, exuding a calm demeanor, leaving us alone in the newly dark, empty space. We find ourselves transported to a high-school basketball game, where teenage boys are engaged in a fast-paced, intense match. One team, dressed in matching pale blue and white uniforms, scores a basket, prompting the perky cheerleaders to leap energetically as the crowd erupts in excitement. Seated in the bustling bleachers, adjacent to the lively high school band, is a group of approximately twenty teenage girls, all dressed in coordinating pale blue and white uniforms. Among them, Jane sits beside Angela Hayes. At the age of sixteen, Angela is strikingly beautiful, with perfectly symmetrical features, blonde hair, and a youthful, alluring physique; she embodies the quintessence of the American dream girl. Carolyn drives with Lester slumped inertly in the passenger seat, and she glances at him, uncertain of how to react. The uniformed girls now stand in formation on the gym floor, and in the bustling stands, Lester and Carolyn find their seats. The girls are well-rehearsed, yet their youth makes it challenging for them to convincingly execute the ambitious, Vegas-style routine they are attempting. From his vantage point in the stands, Lester identifies his daughter. Jane performs with focus and dedication, while beside her, Angela dances with an awkwardness that stands in stark contrast to her beauty. Suddenly, Angela directs her gaze toward us and smiles—a lazy, insolent smile that immediately captures our attention. Our focus shifts entirely to Angela, and as the music takes on an eerie, echoing quality, we slowly zoom in on Lester, who watches, utterly captivated. The light on Angela intensifies, growing brighter and sharper, and the other girls fade from view entirely. Lester finds himself alone in the stands, completely entranced, as Angela looks directly at us, dancing exclusively for Lester. Her movements gradually become overtly seductive, as she begins to unzip her uniform, teasing us with an expression that is both innocent and knowing, then...

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: She stands in front of the mirror, her eyes narrowing as she scrutinizes her reflection with a critical gaze, her expression hardening as she speaks to herself in a tone that carries the weight of a threat. Her attention shifts as she notices a smudge marring the surface of the mirror, prompting her to reach out and wipe it clean with a deliberate motion. The sound of the front door opening draws her focus away from the mirror, revealing Carolyn as she steps inside, her face adorned with a smile so confident it seems capable of persuading even the most skeptical of individuals. With that same smile, Carolyn guides a man and woman into the living room, their expressions weary and unimpressed as they take in the dimly lit space, the woman’s face contorting into a skeptical grimace. Carolyn reappears, this time accompanied by a different couple in their fifties, and she stands alongside another couple, an African American pair in their late twenties, the woman visibly pregnant. By the pool, Carolyn positions herself next to two women in their forties, her hand reaching for the sliding glass door to lock it securely before she begins to draw the vertical blinds closed. She pauses abruptly, standing motionless as the blinds cast shadows across her face, and suddenly, she is overcome with emotion, her body shaking with brief, staccato sobs that seem to escape her control. In a sudden, jarring motion, she slaps herself hard, but the tears persist, prompting her to slap herself again and again until the sobbing ceases. She stands there, her breathing deep and measured as she regains her composure, and with a renewed sense of purpose, she finishes closing the blinds, her demeanor once again professional. She exits the room with a calm, steady stride, leaving behind the dark, empty space. The scene shifts to a high-school basketball game, where teenage boys engage in a fast-paced, intense match. One team, clad in pale blue and white uniforms, scores a basket, prompting the perky cheerleaders to leap into the air with enthusiasm as the crowd erupts in cheers. In the bleachers, near the high school band, a group of about twenty teenage girls sits, all dressed in matching pale blue and white uniforms. Among them, Jane sits beside Angela Hayes, who at sixteen, captivates with her striking beauty, her features perfectly symmetrical, her blonde hair framing a nubile young body, embodying the quintessential American dream girl. Carolyn drives with Lester slumped in the passenger seat, her eyes flicking toward him, her mind grappling with uncertainty on how to react. Meanwhile, the uniformed girls assemble on the gym floor, and in the bustling stands, Lester and Carolyn find their seats. The girls, though well-rehearsed, struggle to convincingly execute the ambitious Vegas-style routine they attempt. From his vantage point in the stands, Lester’s gaze zeroes in on his daughter, Jane, who performs with focus, though her movements are awkwardly juxtaposed against Angela’s. Suddenly, Angela’s eyes meet ours, and she smiles, a lazy, insolent smile that draws us in. Our attention locks onto Angela, and the atmosphere shifts as the music takes on an eerie echo. We slowly zoom in on Lester, who watches, entranced, as the light on Angela intensifies, causing the other girls to fade from view entirely. Lester finds himself alone in the stands, captivated, as Angela’s gaze fixes on us, her dance now solely for Lester. Her movements become overtly sensual as she begins to unzip her uniform, her expression a tantalizing blend of innocence and knowing, drawing us further into her spell.

She stands there taking deep breaths until she has everything under control then pulls the blinds shut once again all business. She walks out calmly leaving us alone in the dark empty room. We are at a highschool basketball game where teenage boys play a fast and furious game. One team wearing pale blue and white uniforms scores a basket. Perky cheerleaders jump up and down as the crowd goes wild. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Seated in the bleachers next to the high school band is a group of about twenty teenage girls dressed in pale blue and white uniforms. Among them Jane sits next to Angela Hayes. At sixteen Angela is strikingly beautiful with perfect even features blonde hair and a nubile young body. she is the archetypal American dream girl. Carolyn drives with Lester slumped in the passenger seat and Carolyn stares at him unsure of how to respond. The uniformed girls now stand in formation on the gym floor and in the crowded stands. Lester and Carolyn find seats. They are wellrehearsed but too young to carry off the ambitious Vegas routine they are attempting. Lester watching from the stands picks out his daughter. Jane performs well concentrating while dancing awkwardly. next to her is Angela. Suddenly Angela looks right at us and smiles a lazy insolent smile. We are focused on Angela now and everything starts to shift as the music acquires an eerie echo. We zoom slowly toward Lester as he watches transfixed. The light on Angela grows stronger and the other girls disappear entirely. Lester is suddenly alone in the stands spellbound as Angela looks directly at us now dancing only for Lester. Her movements take on a blatantly erotic edge as she starts to unzip her uniform teasing us with an expression that is both innocent and knowing. then.

The front door opens to reveal Carolyn greeting us with the smile she thinks could sell ice to an Eskimo. Smiling. Carolyn leads a man and woman into the living room. They are thirtyish and they have seen a lot of houses today. The man and woman glance around the dark room unimpressed and the woman wrinkles her face skeptical. Carolyn enters followed by a different couple in their fifties and stands with another couple African American late twenties. The woman is pregnant. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: He glares at his shadow skeptically and whispers this as if it were a suggestion, then observes a dot on the window and brushes it away. The garage gate swings open to expose Maxwell, welcoming them with the grin he believes could sell sand to a camel. Grinning, Maxwell guides a boy and girl into the library. They're fortysomething, and they've inspected a slew of offices today. The boy and girl peer around the bright space, amazed, and the girl crinkles her nose, uncertain. Maxwell enters, trailed by another pair in their sixties, and stands with yet another duo: Dalmatians, mid-thirties. The girl is holding a suitcase. Maxwell stands by the fountain alongside two sixtyish gentlemen. He opens the sliding bookcase door and begins to draw the horizontal curtains open, then pauses. Remaining utterly motionless, with the curtains throwing lines across his face, he begins to laugh: soft, melodic giggles that apparently emerge against his will. Abruptly he pats himself, gently, but the giggles persist. He pats himself again and consistently until he ceases laughing. He stands there, inhaling deeply until he manages everything in check, then draws the curtains open, once more all professional. He strolls out serenely, leaving them isolated in the dim, vacant space. They're at a college soccer match where teenage girls engage in an intense and spirited clash. One group donned in deep orange and black gear scores a goal. Energetic mascots leap energetically as the audience roars. Positioned in the bleachers, beside the college orchestra, is a cluster of about thirty teenage boys, attired in deep orange and black gear. Among them, John sits beside Margaret Blue. At eighteen, Margaret is remarkably stunning, with perfect symmetrical features, brunette locks, and an agile young frame; she's the epitome of the American fantasy girl. Maxwell skates with Nancy hunched in the driver seat, and Maxwell glares at her, uncertain of what to say. The uniformed boys now arrange themselves in formation on the court floor, and in the packed benches, Maxwell and Nancy secure spots. They're impeccably practiced, but too inexperienced to pull off the grandiose Paris routine they're trying. Maxwell, observing from the benches, identifies his son. John performs admirably, focusing, while moving clumsily beside him is Margaret. Abruptly Margaret gazes directly at them and smirks, a slow, defiant grin. They're centered on Margaret now, and everything begins to rotate as the sound acquires a ghostly resonance. They zoom gradually toward Maxwell as he observes, mesmerized. The gleam on Margaret grows brighter, and the other boys vanish entirely. Maxwell is abruptly alone in the benches, entranced, as Margaret gazes directly at them now, moving solely for Maxwell. Her actions adopt an overtly enchanting flair as she starts to unfasten her gear, teasing them with a look that's both naive and wise, then.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Carolyn greets potential buyers with a smile she believes is persuasive, leading different couples into a dark living room that leaves them unimpressed. As Carolyn stands by the pool with two women, she suddenly begins to cry, slapping herself until she regains composure, then resumes a professional demeanor. Later, at a high-school basketball game, teenage boys play intensely while cheerleaders energize the crowd. In the bleachers, Jane sits with Angela Hayes, an archetypal American dream girl. Carolyn and Lester, seated in the crowd, watch as Jane dances with a group, her performance juxtaposed by Angela's standout beauty. During the routine, Angela captures Lester’s attention, smiling insolently and projecting an erotic allure that isolates Lester in a hypnotic vision, with Angela seemingly dancing just for him.
